chargeHist.descr: Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred judgment agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed. The defendant has not been convicted of the dismissed charges.

The defendant David C. Schuette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Steven Michael Lucareli in court.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Lucareli statement to status- request additional time for defendant to complete CS hours- Sowinski statement - will give additional 30 days or will file a motion to rescind - Court extends to next date  Review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

2:28 p.m. Defendant David C. Schuette in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State/Lucarelli/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 1 year
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Community Service  - 20 hrs
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 2:32 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

3:03 p.m. Defendant David C. Schuette in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli.  Jodie Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend to violation of 961.41(3g)(b) - Possession and to add violation of of 947.01(1) - disorderly conduct - both misdemeanors. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Disorderly Conduct and defers entry of judgment on Possession under 961.47 - terms to be imposed at sentencing hearing. Bail continued. Adj. 3:12 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter
NO contact with any individual listed in complaint.

2:23 p.m. Attorney Steven Michael Lucareli in court via telephone with leave of Court.  Defendant not in court. Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Lucareli only in receipt of citation on misdemeanor offense.   Complaint to be provided, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived. Lucareli - defendant signed Authorization and was mailed on Friday, 2-5-16 to Clerk and DA. Lucarelli will arrange for defendant's signature on bond if necessary. Michlig statement to bond. Court sets $ sig bond. Bond to be sent to Lucareli and original to be returned to Clerk's office with Defendant's signature. Adj. 2:28 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
